result.description:
The Change Approval Policy activity can create group and user approvals according to the associated Change Approval Policy record. Using the current Change Request and any other inputs defined in the Policy Input script field the activity can evaluate the Change Approval Policy record and apply the corresponding Answer's for each matching Decision.

Any rejection to an approval generated by this activity will result in the Rejected transition.

If no Decisions are matched from the Change Approval Policy then the result of this activity will be Approved.

The Answer's associated to each Decision record from the Change Approval Policy dictate the behavior of the approval.

The following items are the configurable fields for a Change Approval Definition (Answer).

* Approval Action
    * Approve: add an approved Approval record for the current Change Request for the specified User
    * Reject: add a rejected Approval record for the current Change Request for the specified User
    * Add a user approval: add an Approval for the current Change Request for the specified User
    * Add a group approval: add a Group Approval for the current Change Request for the specified Group

* Approver Source
    * Approval Definition: derive the approver from the Change Approval Definition record, either the User or Group field according to the Approval Action
    * Change Request: derive the approver from a field on the Change Request record, either the User field or Group field according to the Approval Action

* Mandatory (Does not apply to the Approve and Reject Approval Actions)
    * True: whilst there are no rejections for the current activity, the activity will wait until a response is received for the generated Approval(s)
    * False: response for the generated Approval(s) is not required in the event that there is an approval

* Wait for (Applies to Group Approvals)
    * First response: the first member of the group to approve will mean the group approval is approved
    * All responses: every member of the group must approve to set the group approval as approved

Keep in mind: 
* This activity contains script fields. Do not use the 'current.update()' method in these script fields because it may cause recursive updates to the current record
* If the associated Change Approval Policy cannot be resolved or is inactive then the result of this activity will be Rejected
result.name: Change Approval Policy

result.description:
The Notification activity sends an email or SMS message to specified users or to all members of a group.

 The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed.  Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
result.name: Notification

result.description:
The Set Values activity sets the value of any field on the current record. 

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.
 
Keep in mind: 
*Using the Set Values activity to set the 'Approval' field on a task does not cancel pending approvals. To approve a task in a workflow, use the Approval Action activity.
result.name: Set Values

result.description:
The Approval Coordinator activity is a container for one or more Approval - User, Approval - Group, and Manual Approval activities.
 
The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'run' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

The result value of the Approval Coordinator activity depends on the actions taken by the approvers and the conditions specified in the 'Wait for' field. Possible result values are:
*Approved
*Rejected
*Deleted
*Cancelled

Keep in mind: 
*When the Approval Coordinator activity completes, the activity sets all pending approvals created by any of the Approval Coordinator's child activities to No Longer Required. 
*If a single user receives multiple approval requests in the same workflow, such as when a user is both a product approver and an executive approver, the workflow skips any approvals for that user after the first.
result.name: Approval Coordinator

result.description:
The Turnstile activity counts how many times a workflow passes through the same point. 
 
Use this activity to prevent infinite loops. This activity is useful when the workflow includes Rollback or Rollback To activities.
 
The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using the 'activity.result' variable from within a script field of the activity. By default, the activity script evaluates if the activity should continue to iterate or stop. Possible result values are: 
*Continue: the 'Allowed iterations' value is greater than the number of times the workflow accessed this activity.
*Cancel: the workflow accessed this activity more times than the 'Allowed iterations' value.
result.name: Turnstile

result.description: Creates On-Call escalation log provided group and source information
result.name: On-Call: Log Escalation Start

result.description:
The Approval - User activity creates a user approval record or a set of user approval records.

Use this activity to request approval records from individual users or users within a group.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'run' function of the activity. 
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity or the workflow that contains this activity was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. By default, the result value is the final approval disposition. This disposition depends on the actions taken by the approvers and the conditions specified in the 'Wait for' and 'When Anyone Rejects' fields. Possible result values are: 
*Approved
*Rejected
*Skipped
*Deleted
*Cancelled

Keep in mind: 
*This activity contains script fields. Do not use the current.update() method in these script fields because this may cause recursive updates to the current record.
*If the activity cannot find records for the approvers assigned in the 'User' field, the default result of the approval is 'Skipped' and the workflow moves through the Approved transition.
result.name: Approval - User

result.description:
The Approval - Group activity creates a group approval record or set of group approval records. The activity generates approval records for each member of the group. As opposed to user approvals, ServiceNow tracks group approvals at the group level. Group approvals let you see which groups approve or reject the request along with the users responsible for the group level approval.

Use this activity to request approvals from users within a group.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'run' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity or the workflow that contains this activity was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. By default, the result value is the final approval disposition. This disposition depends on the actions take by the approvers and the conditions specified in the 'Wait for' and 'When Anyone Rejects' fields. Possible result values are: 
*Approved
*Rejected
*Skipped
*Deleted
*Cancelled
 
Keep in mind: 
*This activity contains script fields. Do not use the 'current.update()' method in these script fields because it may cause recursive updates to the current record.
*If the approval group assigned in the 'Groups' field can not be resolved, the default result of the approval is Skipped and will result in the Approved transition.
result.name: Approval - Group
Parallel Flow Launcher

result.description:
The Catalog Task activity creates a record on the Catalog Task [sc_task] table.
 
Use this activity to create a catalog task for a user to complete.
 
The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are: 
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. The final 'State' value of the catalog task record determines the result value for the Create Task activity. Possible result values are: 
*Closed complete
*Closed incomplete
*Closed skipped
*Deleted
*Cancelled
 
Keep in mind: 
*This activity is only accessible for the workflows running on the Catalog Request Item [sc_request_item] table.
result.name: Catalog Task

result.description:
The Timer activity causes the workflow to pause for a designated time period.  

Use this activity to insert delays into specific locations within a workflow.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the executing record. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the Timer activity is in this state very briefly while initializing, after which it immediately changes to 'waiting'.
*Waiting: The workflow engine ignores the activity until the timer reach the specified duration. The engine then re-invokes the activity using a timer event to transition the workflow to the next activity.
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activty, was cancelled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occured. Review the logs for error details.

Possible result values are:
*Complete: the activity successfully reached the specified duration.
*Cancelled: the activity or workflow was canceled before the timer reached the specified duration.

Please be aware that:
*This activity contains script fields. Do not use the current.update() method in these scripts fields as this may cause recursive updates to the current record.
result.name: Timer

result.description:
The Log Message activity writes information to the workflow log.

Use this activity to add entries to the workflow's log for debugging or tracing purposes. 

The 'Message' variable stores the data to add to the log. This variable can be a string or a JavaScript expression that evaluates to a string.
result.name: Log Message

result.description:
The Approval - User activity creates a user approval record or a set of user approval records.

Use this activity to request approval records from individual users or users within a group.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'run' function of the activity. 
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity or the workflow that contains this activity was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. By default, the result value is the final approval disposition. This disposition depends on the actions taken by the approvers and the conditions specified in the 'Wait for' and 'When Anyone Rejects' fields. Possible result values are: 
*Approved
*Rejected
*Skipped
*Deleted
*Cancelled

Keep in mind: 
*This activity contains script fields. Do not use the current.update() method in these script fields because this may cause recursive updates to the current record.
*If the activity cannot find records for the approvers assigned in the 'User' field, the default result of the approval is 'Skipped' and the workflow moves through the Approved transition.
result.name: Service Approval - User

result.description:
The Generate activity immediately creates task or approval records from any task or approval activities placed after the Generate activity in the workflow execution path. Without the Generate activity, the workflow waits to create any records until reaching the associated activity.

Use this activity to create task or approval records before the workflow reaches the task or approval activity.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.

Keep in mind: 
*To prevent the Generate activity from creating records from certain activities, select the 'Skip during generate' check box on the task or approval activity you want to skip.
result.name: Generate

result.description:
Scriptable order guides allow customers to make a single service catalog request that can generate several ordered items.

Administrators can configure order guides to run automatically, from a workflow or a script to generate a set of ordered items without manually submitting a service catalog request. 
For example, an onboarding workflow for a new employee can run an order guide to automatically order items for that employee.

Keep in mind: 
*This activity will automatically create a service catalog request.

**For more info: http://docs.servicenow.com/?context=Running_Order_Guides_Automatically
result.name: Scriptable Order Guide

result.description:
The Approval Action activity marks the current task record as approved or rejected.
 
The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'run' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity or the workflow that contains this activity was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.
  
You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. By default, the result value of the activity is the final approval disposition selected by the approver. Possible result values are:  
*Approved
*Rejected

Keep in mind:
*When an Approval Action activity marks a task as approved, the activity marks all pending approvals as 'No Longer Required'. This activity behaves differently than the Set Values or Run Script activities when used to set the 'Approval' field value.
result.name: Approval Action

result.description:
The Manual Approvals activity watches and manages any approvals that users add outside of the workflow process. This activity does not create approval records.

Use this activity to pause the workflow when a user adds a manual approval to a record with an associated workflow. The workflow waits for the approval to be completed before proceeding.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'run' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired.
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. By default, the result value of Manual Approvals is the final disposition determined by the actions approvers take. Possible result values are:
*Approved
*Rejected
*Deleted
*Cancelled
*Error

Keep in mind:
If there are no pending manual approvals when this activity executes, the activity immediately completes with a result of 'approved'.
result.name: Manual Approvals

result.description:
The Unlock activity removes a lock created by the Lock activity.

Use this activity to allow other processes to change values on the current record.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Finished: the activity successfully unlocked the record.
result.name: Unlock

result.description:
Invoke a subordinate workflow (sub-flow)

The 'workflow' variable contains a reference to the subflow to invoke.
result.name: Subflow

result.description:
The Lock activity locks the current record for exclusive access by the workflow being executed.

Use this activity to prevent other processes from changing values on the current record.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Waiting: the workflow engine is waiting for a lock on the record.
*Finished: the activity locked the record.
*Timeout: the activity could not lock the record within the specified duration. The activity waits for the duration defined in the 'Delay between attempts' field and repeats the attempt to lock the record. The activity attempts to lock the record the number of times defined in the 'Max. attempts' field before reaching this state.

The result values assigned by this activity are: 
*Success: the activity locked the record. The workflow has exclusive access to this record.
*Failed: the activity could not lock the record.

Keep in mind: 
*The lock only prevents other processes from modifying the record. Another branch in the same workflow can access the record.
*The record is unlocked after reaching the 'Max. duration'. This is equivalent to running the Unlock activity. No lock should persist indefinitely.
result.name: Lock

result.description: Send notification(sms,voice,slack,teams) to a user/s
result.name: On-Call: Send Notification

result.description:
The Rollback activity transitions to an earlier activity and updates all approvals and tasks that have executed between the Rollback activity and the activity that the Rollback activity transitions to. This activity resets activities that branch from activities in the rollback path. As a result, a Rollback activity may reset more than expected because activities do not always execute in a predictable order.
 
This activity resets approvals to 'Requested', and tasks to 'Open'. A workflow should only have one Rollback activity.
 
The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'run' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

Keep in mind: 
*Rollback does not reset Manual Approval activities. When the workflow moves through the Manual Approval stage the second time, it automatically approves or rejects based on the approval state. Placing a Manual Approval activity directly before a RollBack activity causes a loop.
result.name: Rollback

result.description:
The Join activity unites multiple concurrent execution paths into a single transition.

Use this activity to cause a workflow to wait for all activities in multiple paths to finish before continuing.

Possible result values for this activity are:
*Complete: all predecessor activities finished executing and transitioned to the Join activity. 
*Incomplete: all predecessor activities finished executing, but one or more bypassed the Join activity.
result.name: Join

result.description:
The Approval - Group activity creates a group approval record or set of group approval records. The activity generates approval records for each member of the group. As opposed to user approvals, ServiceNow tracks group approvals at the group level. Group approvals let you see which groups approve or reject the request along with the users responsible for the group level approval.

Use this activity to request approvals from users within a group.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'run' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity or the workflow that contains this activity was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. By default, the result value is the final approval disposition. This disposition depends on the actions take by the approvers and the conditions specified in the 'Wait for' and 'When Anyone Rejects' fields. Possible result values are: 
*Approved
*Rejected
*Skipped
*Deleted
*Cancelled
 
Keep in mind: 
*This activity contains script fields. Do not use the 'current.update()' method in these script fields because it may cause recursive updates to the current record.
*If the approval group assigned in the 'Groups' field can not be resolved, the default result of the approval is Skipped and will result in the Approved transition.
result.name: Service Approval - Group

result.description:
The Wait for event causes the workflow to wait at this activity until the specified event is fired.
 
Use this activity to register for an event that is fired by another activity of the workflow and then wait for that event to be fired.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. This activity transitions when the specified event fires.
result.name: Wait for WF Event

result.description: Update escalation level end time
result.name: On-Call: Update Escalation Level

result.description:
A timer that is based on a percentage of an SLA duration.

When a Task SLA is being repaired the activitie's 'repair' condition will be true. This condition should be used to bypass activities that should not be exeuted when a Task SLA is being repaired. The "Default SLA Repair Workflow" bypasses all notification activities to prevent emails from being sent.

Under all other circumstances, the 'normal' condition is true.
result.name: SLA Percentage Timer

result.description:
The SOAP Message activity makes SOAP requests to specified endpoints. You must define the SOAP envelope and endpoint in a SOAP message function record. 

The result values assigned by this activity are:
*Success: the activity received a successful HTTP response code.
*Failure: the activity failed to receive a successful HTTP response code or a SOAP fault was detected in the returned response.

Keep in mind:
*This activity can utilize a MID Server if the target endpoint is located behind a firewall where the MID Server can reside, but can also make direct calls to publicly available endpoints without a MID Server.
*If using a MID Server, it must be configured to use SOAP to run this activity.
result.name: SOAP Message

result.description:
The If activity checks a condition or script to determine which transition a workflow should follow, either 'Yes' or 'No'.

Use this activity to transition workflow to a specific path based on result of condition.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. By default, the result value of the activity is the final result of the condition or script specified. Possible result values are: 
*Yes 
*No

Keep in mind: 
*If you specify both the 'Condition' and the advanced 'Script', both conditions must evaluate to true for the workflow to take the 'Yes' transition.
result.name: If

result.description:
The Return Value activity enables a subflow to return data to its parent flow.

This activity adds the data from the 'value' variable to the return_value field of this context. The workflow activity that runs the subflow includes a 'Map return value to' variable that defines where the parent flow stores the returned data in finds in the subflows wf_context.return_value field.

The returned data can be scalar data, a JavaScript object that can be expressed as a string, or an expression that evaluates to a JavaScript object that can be expressed as a string.

Keep in mind:
*Subsequent Return Value activities within a single subflow overwrite the data of the previous Return Value activity. Use only one Return Value activity per independent transition path.
result.name: Return Value

result.description: Makes On-Call escalation log inactive provided the escalation log id
result.name: On-Call: Log Escalation End

result.description: Creates On-Call escalation level record provided shift,level details
result.name: On-Call: Log Escalation Level

result.description:
Invoke a subordinate workflow (sub-flow) by sys_id - typically used when the subflow is a result of a lookup

The 'workflow' variable specifies the sys_id of the subflow to invoke.
result.name: Subflow by ID

result.description:
The Create Task activity creates a record on any of the tables that extends the Task table.
 
Use this activity to create a task for a user to complete.
 
The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are: 
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.
 
You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. By default, the final 'State' value of the task record determines the result value for the Create Task activity. Possible result values are:  
*Closed complete
*Closed incomplete
*Closed skipped
*Deleted
*Cancelled
 
Keep in mind: 
*Only workflows that run on the Task table, or a table that extends Task, can use this activity.
result.name: Create Task

result.description:
The Create Event activity sends a system event to the event processor. Usually this is used to send an e-mail.

See http://docs.servicenow.com/?context=Events_and_Email_Notification For details on system events.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the executing record. 
Possible state values are:
* finished:

Please be aware that: 
* The system event is registered. There is no guarantee on when the event will be executed although typically it will execute within one minute.
result.name: Create Event

result.description:
The Run Workflow activity runs another workflow as a subflow.

Use this activity run a sub-flow if you do not know the name of the sub-flow to run until run-time.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the executing record. Possible state values are:
*Waiting: the workflow engine is waiting for the sub-flow to finish.
*Cancelled: the activity has been cancelled by the workflow.
*Finished: the sub-flow has completed and this activity is finished.
*faulted: some kind of error occured such as the sub-flow does not exist, or a script error.

The result values assigned by this activity are: 
*Success: the sub-flow ran correctly and the sub-flow did not return a result.
*: the result is set to the value of the sub-flow result, if any.
*Finished: the activity is finished with an error (see state).
result.name: Run Workflow

result.description:
The Branch activity splits the workflow into multiple transition paths from a single activity.

The activity provides a single condition of 'Always'. Authors may draw multiple transitions from this condition.  Optionally, add conditions to selectively transition to one or more activities.

Keep in mind: 
*You can draw multiple transitions from a single activity to subsequent activities. A workflow designed in this way behaves the same as a workflow that uses the Branch activity. Using Branch explicitly shows the workflow designer's intent and can simplify later workflow development.
*Branching can affect the behavior of Rollback activities. See Selecting a Rollback Activity on the ServiceNow Wiki for more information.
result.name: Branch

result.description:
The Attachment Note activity adds an attachment to the current record.

Use this activity to add an attachment, and a comment or work note referring to the attachment, to the current record.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Finished: the activity added the attachment to the record.
result.name: Attachment Note

result.description: Creates On-Call escalation communication record provided shift,level, attempt and communication details
result.name: On-Call: Log Escalation Communication

result.description:
The Rollback To activity transitions to an earlier activity. The Rollback To activity updates all activities that executed between the Rollback To activity and the transitioned to activity. 
 
Use this activity to revert the workflow to an earlier activity. Approvals are reset to 'Requested', and tasks are reset to 'Open' or 'Pending'.

The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'run' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.
 
Keep in mind: 
*The Rollback To activity does not reset Manual Approval activities. When a workflow moves through a Manual Approval activity again, the workflow automatically sets the approval state based on the existing value. Placing a Manual Approval activity directly before a Rollback To activity causes a loop.
result.name: Rollback To

result.description: Finds the corresponding communication record and set the response
result.name: On-Call: Set Escalatee Response

result.description:
The Log Trace Message activity writes a trace message to the log.

Use this activity to log the activity name, the event that last invoked the workflow and the table name of the current glide record.

To log other details, use the Log Message activity.
result.name: Log Trace Message

result.description: Begin workflow
result.name: Begin

result.description: End workflow
result.name: End

result.description:
The REST Message activity integrates with the System Web Services plugin and allows the workflow to send REST messages and process their responses.

Use this activity to invoke REST Message functions defined in the web service.

This activity may optionally use a MID Server.
result.name: REST Message

result.description:
The Wait for condition activity causes the workflow to wait until the current record matches the specified condition.
 
Use this activity to pause a workflow indefinitely until a particular condition is met.
 
The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. The activity transitions when the result value is 'true'.
 
Keep in mind: 
*You cannot use this activity to pause a workflow for a specific time period.
result.name: Wait for condition

result.description:
The Run Script activity runs any script.
 
The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.

Keep in mind: 
*ServiceNow automatically updates the current record. Do not call current.update() in your script.
result.name: Run Script

result.description:
Invoke a workflow (sub-flow)

The 'workflow' variable contains a reference to the subflow to invoke.
result.name: Workflow

result.description: Creates On-Call escalation attempt record provided shift,level,attempt details

result.description:
Provides ability to manage escalation response record:
1 - Inserts record, for tracking notifications awaiting response. Inputs - workflow context id, user id, table, source
2 - Captures response to the notifications. Inputs - user id, table, source, response
3 - Cleans up records. Inputs - workflow context id
result.name: On-Call: Manage Escalation Response

result.description:
The Switch activity performs a check to determine if the value of a passed field or variable is equivalent to one of several case values.
 
Use this activity to check a variable or field value against activity conditions for a matching value. When the value passed in this variable or field matches the value defined in the Condition field of the activity condition, the workflow progresses through that activity condition.
 
The activity state tells the workflow engine how to handle the record being executed. Possible state values are:
*Executing: the workflow engine starts the 'onExecute' function of the activity.
*Waiting: the workflow engine ignores the activity until a specific event to restart the activity is fired. 
*Finished: the activity finished running. See the result value for the outcome of the activity.
*Cancelled: this activity, or the workflow that contains this activity, was canceled.
*Error: a JavaScript error occurred. Review the logs for error details.
 
You can assign a result value using 'activity.result' from within a script field of the activity. By default, the item selected in the 'Variable' or 'Field' activity variable determines the possible result values.

Keep in mind: 
*The Switch activity works when the selected variable or field is a type of choice list , so that the Switch activity uses all the choices as possible transition paths.  
*You can use service catalog variables as the selected 'Variable'.
*ServiceNow recommends only selecting choice list or reference type fields in the 'Variable' or 'Field' activity variables.
result.name: Switch
